SEARCH
Module photos
Package application

Class Photo

java.lang.Object
application.Photo
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Photo extends Object implements Serializable
The Photo class represents a photo and the data associated with it, such as a caption, list of tags, dimensions, and date of capture

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Photo

      public Photo(javafx.scene.image.Image i)
      Photo constructor - Constructs a Photo object from a JavaFX Image, extracting necessary data.
      Parameters:
      i - The JavaFX Image to create the photo from.

    • Photo

      public Photo(File f)
      Alternate Photo Constructor- constructs a Photo object from a File, initializing the necessary data. This is done specifically to handle GIFs.
      Parameters:
      f - The File representing the GIF.

  • Method Details

    • getTagList

      public ArrayList<Tag> getTagList()
      Gets the list of tags associated with this photo.
      Returns:
      The list of tags.

    • getImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage()
      Gets the JavaFX Image representation of this photo. 2 separate cases - one for jpegs, png, and bitmap, the other for GIFS
      Returns:
      The JavaFX Image.

    • getCaption

      public String getCaption()
      Gets the caption of this photo.
      Returns:
      The caption.

    • getDate

      public Calendar getDate()
      Gets the date when this photo was added to the app.
      Returns:
      The date.

    • setCaption

      public void setCaption(String caption)
      Sets the caption for this photo.
      Parameters:
      caption - The new caption for the photo.

    • hasTag

      public boolean hasTag(Tag t)
      Checks if this photo has a specific tag.
      Parameters:
      t - The tag to check for.
      Returns:
      true if the tag is present, false otherwise.

    • addTag

      public void addTag(Tag t)
      Adds a tag to the list of tags associated with this photo.
      Parameters:
      t - The tag to add.

    • removeTag

      public void removeTag(Tag t)
      Removes a tag from the list of tags associated with this photo.
      Parameters:
      t - The tag to remove.
